content.description: An experiment was conducted to assess the effect of baking temperature on the density of bread. A large batch of white bread dough and a large batch of whole wheat bread dough were prepared. Each of the batches was formed into <math alttext="18" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>18</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> loaves, resulting in a total of <math alttext="36" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>36</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> loaves. Each of the white bread loaves was randomly assigned to one of three baking temperatures (low, medium, and high), so that <math alttext="6" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn></math> loaves were baked at the low temperature, <math alttext="6" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn></math> were baked at the medium temperature, and <math alttext="6" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn></math> were baked at the high temperature. A similar process of random assignment was carried out for the whole wheat bread loaves.
content.question: Which of the following are the treatments in the experiment?

choices.label: The type of bread (white, whole wheat)
The two batches of bread dough

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Describe an appropriate method for gathering and representing data.
